A Song<S>7892</S> of degrees<S>4609</S>. Unto thee lift I up<S>5375</S> mine eyes<S>5869</S>, O thou that dwellest<S>3427</S> in the heavens<S>8064</S>.
Behold, as the eyes<S>5869</S> of servants<S>5650</S> look unto the hand<S>3027</S> of their masters<S>113</S>, and as the eyes<S>5869</S> of a maiden<S>8198</S> unto the hand<S>3027</S> of her mistress<S>1404</S>; so our eyes<S>5869</S> wait upon the LORD<S>3068</S> our God<S>430</S>, until that he have mercy<S>2603</S> upon us.
Have mercy<S>2603</S> upon us, O LORD<S>3068</S>, have mercy<S>2603</S> upon us: for we are exceedingly<S>7227</S> filled<S>7646</S> with contempt<S>937</S>.
Our soul<S>5315</S> is exceedingly<S>7227</S> filled<S>7646</S> with the scorning<S>3933</S> of those that are at ease<S>7600</S>, and with the contempt<S>937</S> of the proud<S>3238</S> <S>1343</S> <S>1349</S>.
